human.name: Human
human.description:
In most reckonings, humans are the youngest of the common races, late to arrive on the world scene and short-lived in comparison to dwarves, elves, and dragons. 

Perhaps it is because of their shorter lives that they strive to achieve as much as they can in the years they are given. Or maybe they feel they have something to prove to the elder races, and that’s why they build their mighty empires on the foundation of conquest and trade. 

Whatever drives them, humans are the innovators, the achievers, and the pioneers of the worlds.

halfMoonElf.name: Half Moon-Elf
halfMoonElf.description:
Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents: human curiosity, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of nature, and artistic tastes of the elves. Some half-elves live among humans, set apart by their emotional and physical differences, watching friends and loved ones age while time barely touches them. 

(Of the elven subraces, moon elves are the most common, and most tolerant of humankind.)

halfling.name: Halfling
halfling.description: The comforts of home are most halflings’ goal: a place to settle in peace and quiet, far from marauding monsters and clashing armies; a blazing fire and a generous meal; fine drink and fine conversation. Small and practical, kind and curious, many halflings live among other races, where their hard work and loyal outlook offer them abundant rewards. And, when necessary, their inherent stealth and unassuming nature help halflings to avoid unwanted attention.

halfOrc.name: Half-Orc
halfOrc.description:
The one-eyed god Gruumsh created the orcs, and even those orcs who turn away from his worship can’t fully escape his influence. Half-orcs are not evil by nature, but evil does lurk within them, whether they embrace it or rebel against it. 

Each half-orc finds a way to gain acceptance from those who hate orcs. Some are reserved, trying not to draw attention to themselves. A few demonstrate piety and good-heartedness as publicly as they can (whether or not such demonstrations are genuine). And some simply try to be so tough that others just avoid them.

shieldDwarf.name: Shield Dwarf
shieldDwarf.description:
Kingdoms rich in ancient grandeur, halls carved into the roots of mountains, the echoing of picks and hammers in deep mines and blazing forges, a commitment to clan and tradition, and a burning hatred of goblins and orcs — these common threads unite all dwarves. 

(Of the dwarven subraces, the shield dwarves are somewhat grimmer than their southern Gold Dwarf peers. Once the rulers of mighty kingdoms across - and below - the north, shield dwarves have scattered across the region after centuries of warfare with goblinoid and underdark denizens.)

barbarian.name: Barbarian
barbarian.description:
For every barbarian, rage is a power that fuels not just a battle frenzy but also uncanny reflexes, resilience, and feats of strength. Coming alive in the chaos of combat and thriving in the wilds of their homelands, barbarians embrace their keen, primal nature.

Not every “barbarian” tribe has members of the barbarian class: true barbarians among these people is as uncommon as a skilled duellist or strategist in a town, and they play a similar role in society.

pathOfTheAncestralGuardian.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
pathOfTheAncestralGuardian.description: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. When a barbarian who follows this path rages, they contact the spirit world and call on the warriors of their culture's past. These guardian spirits reach into the material realm to provide their descendents supernatural protection.

pathOfTheBerserker.name: Path of the Berserker
pathOfTheBerserker.description: The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker’s rage, you immerse yourself in the madness of battle, heedless of your health but murderously swift and focused.

pathOfTheTotemWarrior.name: Path of the Totem Warrior
pathOfTheTotemWarrior.description:
Barbarians of this path accept a spirit animal as guide, protector, and inspiration. In battle, this spirit fills you with supernatural might, adding magical fuel to your barbarian rage.

(PC's of the Black Lion tribe of Uthgardt follow the Tiger totem; those of the Sky Pony tribe follow the Eagle.)

druid.name: Druid
druid.description:
Druids are an embodiment of nature’s resilience, cunning, and fury. They claim no mastery over nature: instead, they see themselves the extension of its indomitable will.

Their highest concerns are the delicate ecological balance that sustains life, and the need for civilized folk to live in harmony with nature, not in opposition to it. Druids cast spells oriented toward nature and animals, even gaining the ability to take on feral forms.

circleOfTheLand.name: Circle of the Land
circleOfTheLand.description:
These mystics and sages safeguard ancient knowledge through a vast oral tradition. The circle’s wisest members preside as the chief priests of communities that hold to the nature gods, and serve as advisors to the rulers of those folk.

As a member of this circle, your magic is influenced by the land where you were initiated into the circle’s mysterious rites (in the case of the PC's, either Mountain, Forest, or Arctic.)

circleOfTheMoon.name: Circle of the Moon
circleOfTheMoon.description: Fierce guardians of the wilds, a druid of this circle might prowl as a great cat one night, soar over the treetops as an eagle the next day, and crash through the undergrowth in bear form to drive off a trespassing monster. The wild is in the druid’s blood.

circleOfTheShepherd.name: Circle of the Shepherd
circleOfTheShepherd.description: This circle communes with the spirits of nature, especially of the beasts and the fey, and calls to those spirits for aid. They ward off monsters that threaten them, rebuke hunters who kill more than necessary, and prevent civilization from encroaching on rare animal habitats and on sites sacred to the fey. And wherever they go, the spirits of the wilderness are with them.

fighter.name: Fighter
fighter.description:
Fighters learn the basics of all combat styles. Every fighter can swing an axe, fence with a rapier, wield a longsword or a greatsword, use a bow, and even trap foes in a net with some degree of skill. Likewise, a fighter is adept with shields and every form of armor. 

Beyond that basic degree of familiarity, each fighter specializes in a certain style of combat. Some concentrate on archery, some on fighting with two weapons at once, and some on augmenting their martial skills with magic. 

This combination of broad general ability and extensive specialization makes fighters superior combatants on battlefields and in dungeons alike.

cavalier.name: Cavalier
cavalier.description: The archetypal Cavalier excels at mounted combat. These warriors also excel at guarding themselves and those in their charge from harm, often serving as the protectors of their superiors and of the weak.

champion.name: Champion
champion.description: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

runeKnight.name: Rune Knight
runeKnight.description: These fighters enhance their martial prowess using the supernatural power of runes, an ancient practice that originated with giants. Whether you first found giants' work carved into a hill or cave, learned of the runes from a sage, or met a giant in person, you've learned the craft of applying magic runes to empower yourself and your equipment.

paladin.name: Paladin
paladin.description:
A paladin swears to uphold justice and righteousness: different paladins focus on various aspects of the cause, but all are bound by a sworn oath that grants them power to do their sacred work. Paladins train for years to learn the skills of combat, mastering a variety of weapons and armor. 

Even so, their martial skills are secondary to the magical power they wield: power to heal the sick and injured, to smite the wicked and the undead, and to protect the innocent and those who join them in the fight for justice.

crown.name: Oath of the Crown
crown.description: The Oath of the Crown is sworn to the ideals of civilization: paladins who swear this oath dedicate themselves to serving society and, in particular, the just laws that hold society together. These paladins are the watchful guardians on the walls, standing against the chaotic tides of barbarism that threaten to tear down all that civilization has built.

glory.name: Oath of Glory
glory.description: The Oath of Glory destines you and your companions to achieve historical reknown through deeds of heroism. You're called to train diligently and encourage their companions so they’re all ready when destiny calls.

vengeance.name: Oath of Vengeance
vengeance.description: This oath is a solemn commitment to punish those who have committed a grievous sin. To these paladins, their own purity is not as important as delivering justice, fighting the greater evil, and achieving restitution for those wronged.

ranger.name: Ranger
ranger.description: Warriors of the wilderness, rangers specialize in hunting threats against the edges of civilization: humanoid raiders, rampaging beasts and monstrosities, and mighty giants and dragons. They move stealthily through the wilds, hiding themselves in brush and rubble. Rangers focus their combat training on specific types of foes, and acquire the ability to cast spells that harness nature’s power.

beastMaster.name: Beast Master
beastMaster.description: This archetype embodies a bond between the civilized races and the beasts of the wild. United in focus, animal and ranger fight the monsters that threaten town and the wilderness alike.

hunter.name: Hunter
hunter.description: These rangers accept their place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness. The hunter’s path is one of specialized techniques for fighting the threats they face, from marauding ogres and hordes of orcs to towering giants and terrifying dragons.

swarmKeeper.name: Swarm Keeper
swarmKeeper.description: A swarm of intangible nature spirits has bonded itself to you and can assist you in battle. Until you die, the swarm remains, crawling on you or flying around within your space (you determine its appearance.)

rogue.name: Rogue
rogue.description: Rogues rely on skill, stealth, and their foes’ vulnerabilities to get the upper hand in any situation. They have a knack for finding the solution to just about any problem, demonstrating a resourcefulness and versatility that is the cornerstone of any successful adventuring party.

scout.name: Scout
scout.description: You are skilled in stealth and surviving far from the streets of a city. Rogues of this archetype are at home in nature, serving as the eyes and ears of companies as they range across the wilderness.

swashbuckler.name: Swashbuckler
swashbuckler.description: You focus your training on the art of the blade, relying on speed, elegance, and charm in equal parts. A Swashbuckler excels in single combat, and can fight with two weapons while safely darting away from an opponent.

thief.name: Thief
thief.description: You hone your skills in the larcenous arts: in addition to improving your agility and stealth, you learn skills useful for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages, and using magic items you normally couldn’t employ.

sorcerer.name: Sorcerer
sorcerer.description: Sorcerers carry a magical birthright conferred upon them by an exotic bloodline, some otherworldly influence, or exposure to unknown cosmic forces. One can’t study sorcery as one learns a language, any more than one can learn to live a legendary life. No one chooses sorcery; the power chooses the sorcerer.

divineSoul.name: Divine Soul
divineSoul.description:
The spark of magic that fuels these sorcerers comes from a divine source: a distant but powerful familial connection to a divine being, or one's alignment with a religious prophecy.

(In this campaign, contender deities would be Tyr Grimjaws, the even-handed Lord of Justice; Eldath, the goddess guardian of groves and watersheds; or Moradin Soul-Forger, the father of all dwarves.)

draconic.name: Draconic Bloodline (Silver, Red, or White)
draconic.description: Your innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with your blood or that of your ancestors. Most often, sorcerers with this origin trace their descent back to a mighty sorcerer of ancient times who made a bargain with a dragon or who might even have claimed a dragon parent. Some of these bloodlines are well established in the world, but most are obscure.

stormSorcery.name: Storm Sorcery
stormSorcery.description: Your innate magic comes from the power of elemental air and water. Perhaps you were born during a howling gale so powerful that folk still tell stories of it, or your lineage might include the influence of potent creatures such as djinni or marids. Whatever the case, the magic of the storm permeates your being.

wizard.name: Wizard
wizard.description:
Emerging from the subtle weave that permeates the cosmos, the power of magic draws students who seek to study and master its mysteries. Wizards live and die by their spells: everything else is secondary. 

They discover new spells as they experiment and grow in experience, and can also learn them from other wizards, from ancient tomes or inscriptions, and from ancient creatures steeped in magic.

conjuration.name: School of Conjuration
conjuration.description: As a conjurer, you favor spells that produce objects and creatures out of thin air. You can conjure billowing clouds of killing fog or summon creatures from elsewhere to fight on your behalf. As your mastery grows, you learn spells of transportation and can teleport yourself across vast distances, even to other planes of existence, in an instant.

transmutation.name: School of Transmutation
transmutation.description: You are a student of spells that modify energy and matter. To you, the world is not a fixed thing, but eminently mutable, and you delight in being an agent of change. You wield the raw stuff of creation and learn to alter both physical forms and mental qualities. Your magic gives you the tools to become a smith on reality’s forge.

warMagic.name: War Magic
warMagic.description: Rather than specializing in one of the eight traditional schools, this tradition blends principles of evocation and abjuration. It teaches techniques that empower a caster’s spells, while also providing methods to bolster one's own defenses.

thirdScion.name: Third Scion
thirdScion.description:
Jagrin Grannath is the Auvandell's Patrol Leader, singlemindedly determined to protect his town from all threats of the wilderness. Rodrick and Karst are his two twin sons, neither as grim as their father but, as the town's two Patrol Captains, nonetheless carrying on his work. And you are their younger sibling, not more than months old when your mother was slain on patrol by orcs.

Your relationship with your father may be antagonistic, one of unrealized devotion, of bland tolerance, or anything else: but you look up to both your older brothers, ensconced as they are in the town's defense and admired as they are by the other townsfolk for their leadership and hard work.

acolyte.name: Acolyte
acolyte.description: You have spent your life in the service of a temple. You act as an intermediary between the realm of the holy and the mortal world, performing sacred rites and offering sacrifices in order to conduct worshipers into the presence of the divine.

cityWatch.name: City Watch
cityWatch.description: You have served the community where you grew up, standing as its first line of defense against crime. You're not a soldier, directing your gaze outward at possible enemies. Instead, your service to your hometown was to help police its populace, protecting the citizenry from lawbreakers and malefactors of every stripe.

entertainer.name: Entertainer
entertainer.description: You thrive in front of an audience. You know how to entrance them, entertain them, and even inspire them. Your poetics can stir the hearts of those who hear you, awakening grief or joy, laughter or anger. Your music raises their spirits or captures their sorrow. Your dance steps captivate, your humor cuts to the quick. Whatever techniques you use, your art is your life.

folkHero.name: Folk Hero
folkHero.description: You come from a humble social rank, but you are destined for so much more. Already the people of your home village regard you as their champion, and your destiny calls you to stand against the tyrants and monsters that threaten the common folk everywhere.

hauntedOne.name: Haunted One
hauntedOne.description: You are haunted by something so terrible that you dare not speak of it. You’ve tried to bury it and run away from it, to no avail. The burden has taken its toll, isolating you from most people and making you question your sanity. You must find a way to overcome it before it destroys you.

guardianOfTheSpring.name: Guardian of the Spring
guardianOfTheSpring.description:
An orphan, you were taken in by the venerable, mute elven druid who guards the Hopespring. Regardless of your magical skills, Thillùrän ("Silvertop" to most townsfolk) has trained you in the arts of watching and working the natural world. Only you (and, to significantly lesser degree, the Chief Councilor Halgra) have mastered the druidic sign-language he uses to communicate.

Through this, he's also passed on a strong knowledge of the region's history -- though there is still much, you feel, he has yet to relate. In most other regards, your life has been similar to that of other townsfolk, including monthly patrol participation.

acolyte.name: Acolyte
acolyte.description: You have spent your life in the service of a temple. You act as an intermediary between the realm of the holy and the mortal world, performing sacred rites and offering sacrifices in order to conduct worshipers into the presence of the divine.

archaeologist.name: Archaeologist
archaeologist.description: An archaeologist learns about the long-lost and fallen cultures of the past by studying their remains — their bones, their ruins, their surviving masterworks, and their tombs. Those who practice archaeology travel to the far corners of the world to root through crumbled cities and lost dungeons, digging in search of artifacts that might tell the stories of monarchs and high priests, wars and cataclysms.

factionAgent.name: Faction Agent
factionAgent.description: Many organizations active in the North employ listeners, rumormongers, smugglers, cache-holders, haven keepers, and message-drop minders, to name a few. You served as an agent of a particular faction, the Harpers. Becoming an adventurer doesn’t necessarily require you to relinquish membership, and it might enhance your status.

hermit.name: Hermit
hermit.description: You lived in seclusion — either in a sheltered community such as a monastery, or entirely alone — for a formative part of your life. In your time apart from the clamor of society, you found quiet, solitude, and perhaps some of the answers you were looking for.

inheritor.name: Inheritor
inheritor.description:
You are the heir to something of great value — not mere coin or wealth, but an object that has been entrusted to you and you alone. Your inheritance might have come directly to you from a member of your family, by right of birth, or it could have been left to you by a friend, a mentor, a teacher, or someone else important in your life. 

The revelation of your inheritance changed your life, and might have set you on the path to adventure, but it could also come with many dangers, including those who covet your gift and want to take it from you — by force, if need be.

savedOnTheRoad.name: Saved on the Road
savedOnTheRoad.description:
It was your first journey as a newly-minted caravan guard; perhaps it was your first time out of Silverymoon entirely. Whether a flock of perytons, a rampaging owlbear, or something still more sinister, your caravan was set upon and torn apart not more than a day after you'd passed the Hawk's Nest along the Silverymoon Pass. Perhaps others survived; if so, not many beyond you persisted long enough to be encountered by one of the patrols out of Auvandell.

You've spent the last several weeks recuperating (first in the Sanctuary of the Just, then in the Ramblehouse.) Shaken, enraged, grim, or unaffected, you're now beginning to plan the next steps in your thus-far unfortunate career.

guildMerchant.name: Guild Merchant
guildMerchant.description:
You belong to a guild of traders, caravan masters, or shopkeepers. You don’t craft items yourself but earn a living by buying and selling the works of others (or the raw materials artisans need to practice their craft). Your guild might be a large merchant consortium (or family) with interests across the region. 

Perhaps you transported goods from one place to another, by ship, wagon, or caravan, or bought them from traveling traders and sold them in your own little shop.

hauntedOne.name: Haunted One
hauntedOne.description: You are haunted by something so terrible that you dare not speak of it. You’ve tried to bury it and run away from it, to no avail. The burden has taken its toll, isolating you from most people and making you question your sanity. You must find a way to overcome it before it destroys you.

mercenaryVeteran.name: Mercenary Veteran
mercenaryVeteran.description: As a sell-sword who fought battles for coin, you’re well acquainted with risking life and limb for a chance at a share of treasure. Now, you look forward to fighting foes and reaping even greater rewards as an adventurer. Your experience makes you familiar with the ins and outs of mercenary life, and you likely have harrowing stories of events on the battlefield.

outlander.name: Outlander
outlander.description:
You grew up in the wilds, far from civilization and the comforts of town and technology. You’ve witnessed the migration of herds larger than forests, survived weather more extreme than any city-dweller could comprehend, and enjoyed the solitude of being the only thinking creature for miles in any direction. 

The wilds are in your blood, whether you were a nomad, an explorer, a recluse, a hunter-gatherer, or even a marauder. Even in places where you don’t know the specific features of the terrain, you know the ways of the wild.

soldier.name: Soldier
soldier.description: War has been your life for as long as you care to remember. You trained as a youth, studied the use of weapons and armor, and learned basic survival techniques. You were part of the the Argent Legion, the Silver Marches' standing army drawn from its consituent city-state members.

artifactHunter.name: Artifact Hunter
artifactHunter.description:
You’ve always had an interest in magic, but you’re fascinated by legendary magical items. (And, with the ruins of such ancient civilizations as Netheril, Delzoun, and Earlann all nearby, you're hardly starved for material.) You’ve spent years researching mythical relics and committed the stories and legends about them to memory, making you something of an expert on the subject... at least in theory.

Some weeks ago, while on your patrol rotation, you'd mentioned to Patrol Captain Rodrick your desire to leave the city walls and discover more of these fallen kingdoms' artifacts first-hand.

anthropologist.name: Anthropologist
anthropologist.description:
You have always been fascinated by other cultures, from the most ancient and primeval lost lands to the most modern civilizations. By studying other cultures’ customs, philosophies, laws, rituals, religious beliefs, languages, and art, you have learned how tribes, empires, and all forms of society in between craft their own destinies and doom. 

This knowledge came to you not only through books and scrolls, but also through first-hand observation: by visiting far-flung settlements and exploring local histories and customs.

archaeologist.name: Archaeologist
archaeologist.description: An archaeologist learns about the long-lost and fallen cultures of the past by studying their remains — their bones, their ruins, their surviving masterworks, and their tombs. Those who practice archaeology travel to the far corners of the world to root through crumbled cities and lost dungeons, digging in search of artifacts that might tell the stories of monarchs and high priests, wars and cataclysms.

cloisteredScholar.name: Cloistered Scholar
cloisteredScholar.description: As a child, you were inquisitive when your playmates were possessive or raucous. In your formative years, you found your way to an institute of learning, where you were apprenticed and taught that knowledge is a more valuable treasure than gold or gems. Now you are ready to leave your home: not to abandon it, but to quest for new lore to add to its storehouse of knowledge.

sage.name: Sage
sage.description: You spent years learning the lore of the multiverse. You scoured manuscripts, studied scrolls, and listened to the greatest experts on the subjects that interest you. Your efforts have made you a master in your fields of study.

urchin.name: Urchin
urchin.description:
You grew up on the streets alone, orphaned, and poor. You had no one to watch over you or to provide for you, so you learned to provide for yourself. You fought fiercely over food and kept a constant watch out for other desperate souls who might steal from you. You slept on rooftops and in alleyways, exposed to the elements, and endured sickness without the advantage of medicine or a place to recuperate. 

You’ve survived despite all odds, and did so through cunning, strength, speed, or some combination of each.

sundabarranExpatriate.name: Sundabarran Expatriate
sundabarranExpatriate.description:
Perhaps they were done with the guilds' feuding for advantage and more wealth, or perhaps they wanted to take their craft to wider markets. In any event, your family left Sundabar for Auvandell, now happily working either with Arsha Mornstar at the Clamor (as smiths or smelters) or with Lesse Nimrum at the Countinghouse (as accountants, cartographers, or even adepts.)

Perhaps you miss the "stone and suspicion" of your native city; perhaps you'd be happy never to remember a place without trees again. Regardless, you love the Auvandell region as only someone can who's known its absence: if the town needs something to survive, you'll be among the first to volunteer to provide it.

charlatan.name: Charlatan
charlatan.description: You have always had a way with people. You know what makes them tick, you can tease out their hearts’ desires after a few minutes of conversation, and with a few leading questions you can read them like they were children’s books. It’s a useful talent, and one that you’re perfectly willing to use for your advantage.

clanCrafter.name: Clan Crafter
clanCrafter.description: The Stout Folk are well known for their artisanship and the worth of their handiworks, and you have been trained in that ancient tradition. Whether or not a dwarf yourself, you labored for years under a dwarven master of the craft, enduring long hours and dismissive, sour-tempered treatment in order to gain the fine skills you possess today.

guildArtisan.name: Guild Artisan
guildArtisan.description: You are a member of an artisan’s guild, skilled in a particular field and closely associated with other artisans. You are a well-established part of the mercantile world, freed by talent and wealth from the constraints of a feudal social order. You learned your skills as an apprentice to a master artisan, under the sponsorship of your guild, until you became a master in your own right.

guildMerchant.name: Guild Merchant
guildMerchant.description:
You belong to a guild of traders, caravan masters, or shopkeepers. You don’t craft items yourself but earn a living by buying and selling the works of others (or the raw materials artisans need to practice their craft). Your guild might be a large merchant consortium (or family) with interests across the region. 

Perhaps you transported goods from one place to another, by ship, wagon, or caravan, or bought them from traveling traders and sold them in your own little shop.

noble.name: Noble
noble.description:
You understand wealth, power, and privilege. You carry a noble title, and your family owns land, collects taxes, and wields significant political influence. 

You might be a pampered aristocrat unfamiliar with work or discomfort, a former merchant just elevated to the nobility, or a disinherited scoundrel with a disproportionate sense of entitlement. Or you could be an honest, hard-working landowner who cares deeply about the people who live and work on your land, keenly aware of your responsibility to them.

wanderingSavage.name: Wandering Savage
wanderingSavage.description:
One of the North's dozen remaining barbarian clans, you belong either to the Black Lion or Sky Pony tribe. Inexplicable as it was to the townsfolk, your volunteering for patrols on arrival in Auvendell resulted in a rapid and fast friendship with either Rodrick or Karst Grannath.

If a Black Lion, you've left their recently-settled village at Beorunna's Well: likely at the chieftan's direction, to muster commerce and future allies in the civilized lands. If a Sky Pony, you've most likely left because you find your particular band's current raiding of Dwarf caravans shortsighted and craven.

uthgardtTribeMember.name: Uthgardt Tribe Member
uthgardtTribeMember.description: Your people have always tried to hold to the old ways. Tradition and taboo have kept the Uthgardt strong while the kingdoms of others have collapsed into chaos and ruin. You might have grown up one of the tribes that have decided to settle down; or you might come from a segment of the Uthgardt that adheres to tradition. Either way, though you might have only recently arrived in civilized lands, you are no stranger to the values of cooperation and group effort when striving for survival.
